result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:06 PM Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Demari A Straham.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for jury status hearing.
Defendant is here but stepped out for a moment.
Court addresses both parties motions to adjourn.
Statements by the State.
Statements by the Defense.
Court addresses the motion to suppress filed by the defense.
Court will schedule the motion to suppress and reschedule the jury trial.
The original trial order signed 7/5/22 to remain in effect.

Case called at 10:50 AM
Attorney Melissa Zillavy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Demari A Straham.  
Defendant Demari A Straham not in court. 
State requests a Capias and bail be revoked and forfeited.
Court recalls the case at 10:59 a.m.
This is Judge Bohren case and the defendant was on the 1st floor.
Same appearances.
Demari A. Straham appeared in court.
Case remains on the trial calendar.

DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $10,000.00, NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $5,000.00.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, with the exception of contact with Victim B & C if in the event of an emergency and if they initiate contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

10:05 AM Defendant Demari A Straham in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Demari A Straham.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for bail/bond hearing.
Court addresses WCS letters.
State now appears by Attorney Lesli Boese.
Statements by the Defense.
Court admonishes the defendant.
Court will issue a capias if there is another noncompliance letter from WCS.
State requests additional cash bail.  Arguments by the State.
Additional arguments by the Defense.
For the reasons stated on the record Court increases cash bail t o $15,000.00.  
DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $10,000.00, NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $5,000.00.
Jury status hearing and jury trial dates to remain on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.

Jury status hearing on March 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:57 PM Defendant Demari A Straham in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense states there is a bail motion and then arraignment.
Court will address the bail motion first.
Defense places arguments on the record as to the bail motion.
State places arguments on the record in objection to the bail motion.
Defense places rebuttal arguments on the record.
Court denies the motion for bail modification, so ordered.

Court reviews the amended information.
Defense acknlowdges receipt of the information and waives formal reading and enters a plea of not guilty.
Defendant moves for substitution of Judge.
Court accepts the not guilty plea.
Court denies the motion for substitution of Judge.
Defense is requesting a speedy trial.
Defendant remanded back into the custody of Waukesha County Sheriff.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on January 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:40 AM Defendant Demari A Straham in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Brandon Kircher, of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by DDA Boese.
Cross examination by attorney Wolff.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
The State presents counter arguments.
The Court places its findings on the record.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Attorney Boese states she needs to correct the information and requests an arraignment date.
No objection from Defense.

Additionally, attorney Wolff filed a bail bond motion.
The Court notes that the motion needs to be heard in front of the Trial Court.
The Court will adjourn for an arraignment and a bail bond motion.
Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Attorney Wolff.

11:30 AM Defendant Demari A Straham in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests to address the pending motion to modify cash bail.
Defense places arguments on the record.
State places arguments on the record in objection.
Defense places additional arguments on the record.
Court denies the bail motion.
Defendant remanded back into the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff.
Atty. Peter Wolff.
Bail/bond hearing on January 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on January 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:26 PM Defendant Demari A Straham in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Herbers states they are trying to obtain counsel for defendant.  Defendant requests court appointed counsel.  Court finds a complaint was filed on 1/6/2022, a preliminary hearing was requested within the 10 days, Public Defender's office has made 31 contacts for counsel, defendant is still eligible for public defender representation.  Court adjourns for cause as 2 days have elapsed since his 10 day request for the preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Bail bond hearing date to remain as previously set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on January 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:23 PM Defendant Demari A Straham in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant wishes to address bail today.  The Court denies this request.  The Court is in receipt of an order appointing counsel report that the defendant is eligible for public defender services and they have made numerous contacts but have not yet been able to appoint an attorney.  The Court finds the defendant does want an attorney, that due and diligent efforts have been made to appoint counsel and finds good cause to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Attorney Nimmer requests this matter be set for a bail hearing before the Trial Court.  The Court sets a bail hearing before the Trial Court, a preliminary hearing, and an additional status of counsel date.  Bail remains as fixed.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
